docs.snippet: A new Swedish crime saga, dubbed a Scandinavian version of the U.S. drama series "Breaking Bad", hopes to emulate the success of other Nordic TV exports such as "The Bridge" with a dark tale of marijuana, mafias and motherhood in suburban Stockhol...
docs.lead_paragraph: A new Swedish crime saga, dubbed a Scandinavian version of the U.S. drama series "Breaking Bad", hopes to emulate the success of other Nordic TV exports such as "The Bridge" with a dark tale of marijuana, mafias and motherhood in suburban Stockholm.

headline.main: New Swedish TV Crime Series Targets Global Appetite for Nordic Noir
headline.print_headline: New Swedish TV Crime Series Targets Global Appetite for Nordic Noir

docs.snippet: Utah will assign a state police detective to watch over refugees coming from Syria and elsewhere, the head of the state police force said Monday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Utah will assign a state police detective to watch over refugees coming from Syria and elsewhere, the head of the state police force said Monday.

headline.main: Utah to Assign a Detective to Watch Over Refugees
headline.print_headline: Utah to Assign a Detective to Watch Over Refugees

docs.snippet: The terrorist attack was another blow for this downtrodden working-class city an hour outside Los Angeles, and just at a moment when things seemed to have been improving....
docs.lead_paragraph: The terrorist attack was another blow for this downtrodden working-class city an hour outside Los Angeles, and just at a moment when things seemed to have been improving.
docs.abstract: Many residents of San Bernardino, Calif, express hope that terrorist attack that left 14 people dead at Inland Regional Center will serve as yet another reason for city to continue its struggle for recovery; city has struggled to claw back from recession, and suffers from gang violence, crime and high unemployment.

headline.main: San Bernardino Community Struck by Massacre Seemed on Verge of Turnaround
headline.print_headline: Community Struck by Massacre Seemed on Verge of Turnaround

byline.contributor: Julie Turkewitz contributed reporting from Riverside, and Sheri Fink from Loma Linda.
byline.original: By ADAM NAGOURNEY, IAN LOVETT and RICK ROJAS

headline.main: ‘Chi-Raq’ and the Myth of Chicago Gang Wars

docs.snippet: As part of Michelle Obama's healthy eating initiative, a group of major food retailers promised in 2011 to open or expand 1,500 grocery or convenience stores in and around neighborhoods with no supermarkets by 2016. By their own count, they're far...
docs.lead_paragraph: As part of Michelle Obama's healthy eating initiative, a group of major food retailers promised in 2011 to open or expand 1,500 grocery or convenience stores in and around neighborhoods with no supermarkets by 2016. By their own count, they're far short.

headline.main: Grocery Chains Leave Food Deserts Barren, AP Analysis Finds
headline.print_headline: Grocery Chains Leave Food Deserts Barren, AP Analysis Finds
